body:
When trying to Cythonise a file attempting to declare a variable length array, we get the following error:
```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
    cdef double[n] x
                ^
------------------------------------------------------------

file.pyx:10:17: Not allowed in a constant expression
```

For C users coming to Cython, this may be a bit surprising and certainly not descriptive enough, and it doesn't seem to be mentioned in the documentation (I'm sure somewhere in there is something about Cython generating C89-compliant code, but even that I didn't find, and C programmers would have to know that VLAs were introduced in C99).

My suggestion is to produce a specific error message when a variable-length array is attempted to be declared. This message could be similar to "Cython does not support variable-length arrays".
title: Special-case variable-length array error message
